values:
Well, I suppose I didn't keep up with my promise to keep this going. LOL. 
Recess week is drawing to an end :( I wish its recess month! :(

No, I don't listen to the latest hits or know the hottest new stars or shows.
I like my Studio Ghibli and Disney very much, thank you very much. And yes, at age twenty. :) 
Oh and I love Musicals, Vocal performances (this is why I love Glee) and Orchestra music very much. They too, bring me to different worlds! and they keep me dreaming. 

Now, don't you think songs like "Defying Gravity" and "Part of your World" much more uplifting and encouraging than songs about clubbing, sex and whatever lousy lyrics on 80% of new songs out there? Of course, there are some nice new songs too...And no, I am not counting in jpop (or Asian pop in general cause well, there are nice and cute chinese songs too, korean too), I like my tegomasu/news very much still. Hahha! xD 


Not forgetting, ze lovely praise & worship songs of course. :)

At times like this I really want to watch a Studio Ghibli or Disney movie. 
Simply because they bring me to a different world. :}
Yes, I just want to escape from the pressures, demands and stresses of this world. 
At least, let me have time with my God! Yet, I am so tired I can't even focus. :( 

And I just wasted time posting this. 
But I needed to get it out!

The night of the day that mummy and my brother went back (yes they came, for 1 week exactly), I got fever. And on-off headaches since before and after the fever, backaches and sore throat. And so with all these ailments, I am not exactly able to study to the best of my ability. But I suppose because of these ailments, I was granted more rest at last. 

I finally took up the book I started but never got to progress on. (How to Have a Mary Heart in a Martha World, belonging to tracy) From there, Jesus seemed to say: "Mila, mila. You are anxious and worried about many things. Come to me and I will give you rest. Take my yoke for it is easy and my burden is light."

Just this morning I was reading the story of the man who was given the task (by God) to bring a wheelbarrow containing 3 rocks up to the mountain. Along the way though, the wheelbarrow gets cluttered with many many things, light and heavy from helping with the burdens of others. As the wheelbarrow gets heavier, the man's joyful and thanksgiving heart is replaced with bitterness, whines and complaints. God then came to meet him and said that all He wanted was for him to carry his own burden. Of course its good to help, but don't do what is too much for you. God never gives more than what you can bear. And leaving all the the things behind, he went on, up to the mountain with only the 3 rocks in his wheelbarrow. 

I suppose I have to learn from that. :) I must learn not to keep saying yes and okay to everything. There is a need to keep my spiritual being in check, or I'll end up bitter and blaming God. 

As of today, I am 85% recovered (still have sore throat and a bit of headache today, though yesterday I was perfectly fine) and as I recover, I think my spiritual being is also recovering. I do believe that as I recover spiritually, slowly, other aspects of my life will recover too. 

Truth to be told, I secretly think I have depression when I am alone. HAHAH. When my family went back, I came home and I finally don't have to hold on to my tears of stress and bitterness anymore and I cried all I want and can. HAHAH. I have been holding it back because I don't want my mummy to fuss. 

I have been very unhappy with myself. Feels insecure about appearance, feels fat (but I still want to eat anyway and I abhor it when people judges people who eat at night whenever they are hungry. YES, I am that kind of person but I'd rather go to sleep happy and satisfied than starve myself, thank you very much) feels that my hair is terrible, my complexion terrible, lazy to dress up to school and so feels insecure at times (but I still don't want to dress up too nicely for school because if I dress nicely for school, then the special days to dress up won't be special anymore).   

I have been unhappy with others, and bitter that some people are blessed yet they don't see it and keep complaining some more, rubbing my lousiness of my school work at my face. not just school work though, have been unhappy with how some people are.

I have been unhappy with the state of my family, to the extent of bitterness to God. how I can't communicate well with them no matter how much I try. how I cannot have a normal family lifelihood cause their life is there and mine here. its very painful and saddening. 

and I have been very very stressed about my studies. God knows how horrendous my GPA is and so I really plan to do well, I plan to really study hard this sem and pull my meagre GPA up. but then I need to do this, do that, go here, go there, there is hardly any time to study! and when I finally have time, I am so tired that I keep falling asleep as I study. 

hence I have been very tired about many many things and I feel so weary, bitter and burnt out despite all that I've received in conference and NYC camp. 

but that's going to turn around. and I know that even when life sucks so much, God is always good. Slowly, one by one. God will turn it around. I only need to keep holding on to Him. :)
 
I have some nice moments and rests this week as I recover. :) Cooking and eating breakfast with jingying, lunch with ing and rei, studying at cat socrates with rei, receiving mummy's text telling me to take care and not be stressed (actually she knew all along, i was so touched I teared when I read), making jellyfish for tomorrow's hopekids event. :)  I thank God for all of it. 

I am going to sleep now :) I haven't done my tutorial and studied my french and japanese. but one by one. I only need to keep holding on to Him. :) 

Tomorrow is a day out with the kids! :D 
and on Sunday, all afternoon and night is for studying only. :)

Luke 10:41-42 “Martha, Martha,” the Lord answered, “you are worried and upset about many things, but few things are needed—or indeed only one. Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.” honestly, I think I have been having the martha syndrome. :( you see, there are so many things that needs to be done! and if I were to not do it, what if nobody did? some tasks are entrusted to me, others can only be done by me because I have the materials, and others are initiated by me, so its only right that I do it. But I am getting really tired here, and I have been compromising on Quiet time and I hate it. :( And I think why I am tired is because I haven't been spending enough time with God. But you see, I am finding it very hard to find the balance between mary and martha. I mean, I can't just throw away my responsibilities. then I appear without my work done then what am I to say? "Oh, I needed to sit at the feet of Jesus..." then everyone can just say that to get out of their responsibilities. Yet I can't go on like this, like martha. I'll get angry and bitter. At God even. God, help me! And I just wasted time to type this. But I figured this would take lesser time than to pen it on to my journal. besides, I still need to find something on the internet. Dear God, my prayer is that you help me to remember what is the one important thing, and that is to be near to you. I know that you hear every single word of my prayer and I know that you are always there and that all I need is to draw near to You. I apologise for the times I didn't, simply because I was so tired and just wanted to sleep. God, please give me strength to finish all the tasks entrusted to me. Please also grant me wisdom to properly understand my school work that I am getting a bit stressed of. I know that You mean me well, always. Keep me close to You and be my strength, God. In Jesus' name I pray, Amen. :) And God? Thank you for letting me get Forensic Science this morning. :) Love You.

I am feeling superbly stressed right now. :( God, I hate this, I feel so cluttered and distracted by so many things! Suddenly there is so much I need to do, so much I need to read, prepare, gather, write, buy, make, pray for, study, listen, ask, understand! @.@

There are so many things clamoring for my attention and I wish I can shut them all up. I need time to be still.




I think I have fallen in love with rain. actually, I have always loved rain but I never admitted it. I love rain simply because its cold. of course, I don't like it when I have to walk in it. but I love being indoors when it rains. i am very happy that today i wore my m&m's sweater. teehee! :D I am also very happy that nihongo lessons are with amanda once again! its the best to be in nihongo lesson with a friend. :} so thank God for amanda! :D

okay mila, one by one, slowly.
but it feels better to let it out. :)

eventually, mila will
"dance! dance! dance in Your freedom,
Oh Your glorious freedom,
Forevermore, forevermore" :D

yes, I know I will. :) so stop clamoring for my attention everything, for my God will back me up and I will face you one by one. and stop putting negative thoughts in my mind and heart, satan. for God will get you like how many times He had when you play your stupid tricks on His children. hmph.

Hello, I am almost to lazy to revive this journal. AHAHA. 
but I am too bored now so here I am. :) 
currently in Indonesia now, haha. 

Much has happened since my last post, LOL. 
Well, that goes without saying since its been 5 months isn't it?

my title says, hatachi ni narimashita which translates to I have turned 20. :) At age 20, I am well advancing to adulthood. but then even though I am now 20, and still very much childish in many ways, I refuse to behave in a way that is not myself just because I should behave my age. After all, I do believe that being a genuine person is more important that acting your age. :) And like massu, I shall remain a kid till I am 26 xD HAHAH. Okay, maybe until I get married. AHAHAHAHAH xD 

That is if God intends me to get married in the first place. xD 

Anyway, I have been very blessed on my birthday. :) 
God has blessed me much with but I just have to mention my lovely cg. :) I really have grown so much, to warm up and to love them, every single one of them. And today, I am really very blessed that every single one of my cg member came down to celebrate my birthday. Having been in church for a while, I am bound to know that no cg will ever forget your birthday. HAHA! but I really didn't think that my cg would really celebrate my birthday with me today because this week is rather packed with sub-D, and tomorrow pre-relationship seminar (AHAHA, I still think its weird that I am going for this xD but everyone is so.. yea. HAHA) so I didn't expect for them to be available to celebrate on the day itself. :} and I am so really very touched. :) 

And you know I really feel that every single CG that God placed you in is bound to touch you and grow you in different ways :) I really love my current CG and I refuse to compare it to any other CG I was ever in. Because every single one has touched and blessed me and grew me in different ways and I am thank God for EVERY CG I was ever in. :) 

But I have to say that, God really grew me much as a person ever since I have moved to Uni-YA. Don't get me wrong, Youth was awesome but I think God really used the then-new season of my life and the new congregation to grow me to be who I can be in Him. Though I still take time to warm up to people, but God has given me better ability to learn to be vulnerable and be open and genuine in all that I do. And without knowing, God has also grown me to be a more secure being in Him and His people, God has even grown me to be able to encourage and influence others around me, in the little that I can do. And really, I never thought myself to be influential. HAHAH. but its really not me. Its God. :) and its all God's glory. Thank you God :D 

and from now on too, I am praying and hoping for myself to continue to grow in my love for God and to really be able to show God with my life. I want God to be evident in my life and for my life to be consistent with what I proclaim. And I really hope to be able to serve Him in greater ways, specifically as a shepherd, to join hopetots and to join choir when there is one. hahah! I really wish to be able to lead the people around me too, to God and His love. :) 

God is good! :D okay, I need to go now! :) oyachumi! 

P.S. I love massu's hair color now :} 
and Aoi Benchi is absolutely awesome. I love everything about it and about massu. Massu's voice is awesome and his singing has improved even more. :} Absolutely love him xD And I am loving tego too! He's looking good with his current hair. and both their outfits have been very awesome! except for...massu's pants. HAHAH. Massu's outfits have been awesome except for all the pants, HAHAH. they are so weird that I can't even like it. HAHA. 
OH, and I have to say, I really really like kei-chan's new solo. :} if he were to debut, I'll absolutely buy his single. And I honestly think his singing is better than pi's :P Personal preference! :)

Okay, I have decided, I shall face my feelings and let it all out. All these feelings boiling inside me is not good for health, physically, emotionally, mentally or spiritually. Hahah! Yeayeayea, I have been feeling little bits of sadness since I got back from Cambodia. 

Number 1. I feel lonely and I miss being part of and traveling as a team. T_T But I will eventually get accustomed to being alone and doing things on my own again, just that there are withdrawal symptoms of my stm team/cg and also, of cambodia. I kinda miss cambodia, and I miss my lovely kids T_T 

Number 2, and not something so easy, is my results. 
Mila's GPA is 3.50 and Mila is not happy about it. At first, I was feeling alright about it but then the truth starts sinking in and I feel pretty disappointed and unhappy about it. 3.50 for a first semester, its not very good is it? And people are telling me not to be too hard on myself and that I can pull it up and to ganbatte for the coming semester. But...that's really not the point. 

Honestly, the reason why I am so upset about my mediocre results is that I am once again, mediocre and average. Its not that I am not thankful but I can't help but feel disappointed and I worry that God won't be my victor. My results cause me to question God why is it that I am average yet again? And to be very honest and raw in my feelings, I question God, why He never make me victorious? Isn't God my deliverer? And isn't God for me? And what makes me very upset also, that why is it that others who seem to have worst attitude than me or never put in as much effort, would do better than me? God, I am not very smart, I am very average, and why I am upset is because I feel that I do not see You coming through in my studies and it also makes me worry that I am not living my study life for God. 

And I don't know if You planned me to study econs. God I still don't know. :c cause I don't mind it but then the mediocre results and the math/stats is making me doubt again. It makes me want to write in an appeal to change course to bio science. To quit school and go overseas to study biology or better still, medicine. God, I don't know what is it you mean for me in my study life. T_T 

And I am unable to just brush off my mediocre results aside because what pulled me down is my core economic modules. T_T I am afraid that I am unable to do well for my core modules, then how will I eventually do well? 

But I know and I know, that You still have Your best plan for me to prosper me and I am holding on to that. And I refuse to resign to the lies that satan plants in my head. Because God is still the best ever and I still love God very, very much. :) 

Ah, indeed, it feels good to let all the oppressing negative/bitter feelings/thoughts out. 

No matter what happens, at the end of the day, everything will come in His time. :D 
My time to shine will come. And I will shine with and for Him, not on my own or on my own accord. :D 
At the mean time, He will keep me safe in this crazy fast-paced world of Singapore. And just in case you were wondering, yes, I have been listening to Corrinne May :) 


<lj-embed id="29"/>

Sometimes, I feel that I am such a lousy piece of being. Because sometimes I look at certain people, especially same age or younger than me who have certain achievements or something that I feel envious about (e.g MANY MANY CLOTHES and the ability to afford those MANY MANY CLOTHES and accessories), I feel like crap about myself. Like, man, what am I doing with my life?! My life still seems so childish, kiddy with no achievements to my name. 

Then I realise that I have been looking at myself and around me. 
I forgot to look up. I forgot to look at myself WITH God. 
And, well, yes, I am not very outstanding or whatever but who cares? 
I have God and that's all that matters. :)

Besides, I am happy as the Mila who enjoys the (more) grown-up stuff such as shopping and dressing up and also the kiddy stuff like watch cartoons, getting excited over new animations and cute toys. :D But better yet, I am happy that I have God's presence with me. :D God's presence always beats. Teehee! :D

Then the a bit mean part of me will look those others and think: man, what are they doing?! :P AHAHAHA
But, honestly, its not with a spirit of self-righteousness, but of "you'd be better off with God." 
Okay, okay. I admit the pride, heh. But how is it possible that one is not proud of being God's child? 
I am proud that I am God's child and made righteous by Him. :D 

P.S. On a fangirl mode, I absolutely love tegomasu. before I left for Cambodia, it was decided that tegomasu is going to have a new single, a cover of sasuke's aoi bench. Of course, I searched for sasuke straightaway and I do like them so! They are a bit yuzu-like! :D And then I came back from Cambodia and then tegomasu's rendition is available on radio rip. Massu and masterhits are the best. :D 

And I ABSOLUTELY ADORE AOI BENCH. both the original and tegomasu's rendition. But I really really like tegomasu's one, the familiar blending of their voices. :} heart heart heart. HAHAH! And I really like it that they varied the song in which there are parts that massu sings the lead and tego does the harmonising (second chorus). And the lyrics are pretty cute with a small hint of sadness. I like ~ :D 

OH AND I FORGOT TO EXCLAIM; tegomasu is the bestest ever. The single is to be released on my birthday :} 
Its a great present and its a lovely way to start my twenties. :D (OMG, 20 D: I shall take on massu's logic of being a kid till I turn 26 xD)

Though this post is 4 days late, still Happy New Year! :D 
Since exams has ended, Mila has been having a very full life (or so I think, but yeah, I believe its quite full and I felt that I spent my time well) with caroling, baking and gatherings for Christmas and then all the preparations for Short-Term Missions (STM). And that is why I've decided to post, to at least have a new post before I fly to Cambodia. :) 

And so here goes. A new year calls for new resolutions. :) 

1. DEPENDANCE ON GOD 
In 2010, I realise that I am very weak! Even though I can be with God, I can be not properly depending on God. (See previous post) I am with God but not properly with Him, but merely just self-delusional that I am with God. And not depending on God makes me weak weak weak. NO MORE TO THAT and Mila will be making conscious effort to be properly depending on Him :) 

2. FOCUS ON GOD
I know what you are thinking. That its like similar to the first. But no, its not. When I say focus on God, I am saying that I want God to be my focus of every aspect of my life. And with God as my focus, I will naturally depend on Him :) I want my decisions to be based on Him and His plans for me. :D

3. LOVE FOR PEOPLE AS HOW GOD DOES
I want to be gentle like God/Jesus. God is gentle that He will never force His plans on you, He loves and respects you and in case you wonder away, He will always be gently reminding you and guiding you to choose for yourself, God's best for you. 

And that is my resolutions, or perhaps, growing points? :)
And I am very glad to have started the year with God and His community. I think it was such a blessing that the first day of this year is a saturday and it was spent in service, listening to God's word. 
P.S. I love my outfit on Saturday xD 

I think that its divine that my resolutions are very much in accordance to saturday's lesson, in which we learn that in all our battles, we need to fully depend on Him, have a heart fully dependent on Him. :) And what I need to really learn, its to know in out hearts and minds that the battle is God's and it has already been won. And life would be victorious for you if you stay close to and depend on Him. :) Of course I know that in reality its not that simple. But you just have to be stoic in your faith and stick it out with God. 

This year, I want to not be afraid to place myself in trying and pinching situations that forces me to depend on Him. I want to be victorious in His name. And not mine. :) THE LORD IS MY BANNER! (JEHOVAH NISSI) :D

gosh, and I realize that its exactly a month since I've last updated! O.O 
no wonder carol says she has visited for a thousand times to see there is no update, LOL. And so I've come to save this poor journal. 

First things first, I AM FREEEEEEEE :D 
Finally after what feels like being a decade of being locked up by exams, I am freeeeeee. Freee to play, watch tv, go out, paint my nails slowly, bake, shop, think of outfits, sing and whatever. :D And you bet I've got a whole list of things to do, teehee! 

But before going on to anything else, I really want to proclaim that God is really awesome and I honestly think He's the best thing that has happened to me and I am so so so glad that I got round to properly depend on Him in everything that I do. :D God really has seen me through all my exams and His presence is always there if only you choose to be aware of it and His presence is there too, with the people who are my spiritual family, who is always there to offer prayers, helps and company. And really, God's community is best. :D 

It all started after mama left and I feel all empty and bitter even, why is it that God means me to have such a life in which I keep having to say goodbye to family and lovingly prepared dinner and hello to lonely homes and packed dinner. And in my bitterness and sadness, I wasn't happy, I wasn't being a good friend, I wasn't doing my best in everything and I wasn't depending on God. Then came my quiz, I studied and went on to do the quiz and I thought I trusted in God's deliverance. But really in my heart I was still depending on my own human efforts and I was in a self-delusion that I am depending on God. And so in the end, the quiz was really really really badly done and I meant really badly done. And oh, its worse than what you think was bad, I am positive about that. 

I cried. And I asked God why. I did study so. I trusted that You were deliver and that with You I can. And well, God didn't really ask but He did give the impression of asking (and I am sure He did): Did you really? 
And I know I didn't. 

It was good that I refuse to believe that God shortchanged me, because my spirit, my brain and heart knows that God will never ever shortchange me or anyone for that matter because He knows of the plans He has for us that will prosper us and give us a hope and a future. :) 

And I repented and I said God, I really want to depend on You. Not just for exams of course, but also everything else in my life. And came service and I really did feel so much of God's presence and the sermon massage was so very divine, about being the real disciple and making the Word work in your life. There was something about how if you really want to depend on God, you shouldn't have a trigger to it. I got a bit insecure, whether it was too late for me to depend on God, but I asked huimin a little and she says, its never too late to do so. And I decided to scrape aside the lies that satan is trying to put in my head and I went to God. 

So here I am. :) I survived my exams and I might not know how my results will be yet. On my own human efforts, I never would have survived my exams, I never would have persevered (all that math?!), and on my own human efforts, I would be done for. But because I depended on God and He was with me, I believe I'll do pretty alright. :) After all, He is Jehovah Jireh and He will provide, He will deliver. 

Well, He always does! :D 

Its also because I am a student that results are so very important to me that's why the bulk of this post and my experience with God is in my studies. But you know, God really appealed to me to depend on Him on everything and I really understand that true joy and fulfillment and peace comes only in depending on Him and trusting in Him and being obedient to Him (which is natural when you trust God!). And so despite the horrible exams, I will always have joy, will always have something to thank Him for, will always be filled. :) 

I was kept sane to be having exams at such an ungodly-to-be-having-exams period (its Christmas in 2 days!) because of God, church and not forgetting caroling. :) 

I am glad I only pulled out of one caroling session. You know, I really do believe that its better to be tired but joyful from knowing you served God and blessed people (and being blessed yourself in the process) than being tired and stressed from studying on your own. :) Oh, and there is something else. I really do hate it so and I am upset by myself when I let other people's decision affect my own. And though I thank God that I stick by my choice, I still hate it that I was affected. 

And I have been thinking about it. How is it that one person who have experienced and tasted God for oneself simply backslide. At the end of the day, when you choose to look to God, don't you love God? Or do you love yourself more that you choose to let yourself let go of God? I pray that everyone who have backslided would know that when you backslide, you are re-crucifying Jesus. And that knowledge itself, should trigger you to come back to God. After all, you do know God, you know His love and you do love Him. So don't grieve Him and yourself anymore. Come back home to Him. 

P.S. these are just my thoughts, its not directed at anyone! :) 

And look at the time, I am tired. And I should be going to bed now. 
But I do have some thoughts to convey to certain lovely friends who I love so much. 

CAROL: I just want you to know that I want you to make a decision that you will not regret. And that at the end of the day I will always be here and I will never, never judge your choices/actions. Because I know that its not easy. But why I wish you wouldn't enter it is because I wish for you to not be hurt and I hope for you too, to wait for God's best. Because God's approved and God's best will not fail. And you must know that God will always love you no matter what you choose and that He will never, never forsake you. :) I can't wait for christmas breakfast! :D And meetings when we are over 25, 30 and so on and still being the you and me we are today. :}

REI-CHAN: I was going to say that I wasn't angry that in the end you couldn't come for christmas service but then I suppose I was a tad angry. But then rather than angry, I was much, much more disappointed. I was looking forward to you coming for service so much! Because you are so important to me, I really pray and hope for you know God for who He is, cause though you know Him, there is so much more that you haven't known of Him yet. And I know that I cannot force spiritual things on a person that still don't have a spiritual appetite but I just want you to know that God loves you even more than I do (which is a lot xD) and that God thinks you are really beautiful. :) P.S and you know I love your fashion. ;D 

ING-CHAN: I want some quality time alone with you/rei-chan! Don't get me wrong, le boyfriend is really a nice person but I do so want some girl time with you as well! Let's go eat Ginza Bairin and talk the afternoon away! And do you really mean it when you say you don't want to go for christmas service? I don't mean to be sensitive and I don't want to sound like a all-too-holy friend but I want to be honest with you. I wish for you to consider coming for christmas service and I wish for you to hold God in greater and closer regard. After all christianity is nowhere a religion, really. Its a relationship. All this because you are really important to me as well. But no matter what, I am so happy you are back and now that I've ended exams, let's meet up and spend lazy afternoons together. :D 

Well that was long. I am going to bed. 
Tomorrow I am going to eat bagel for breakfast with Vanilla ceylon tea before I visit the supermarket to get some stuff for Christmas. Oh and tomorrow should be the day I receive my present from NEWS, my Dome Party DVD. xD Okay, Good Night. :D

Since uni started, I haven't got any time to cook T_T 
i miss cooking !! i miss my tamago, soboro and my sandwich. :x 
i am not bragging, they are oishii okay! 

today was fun :D 
but rei days are always fun !! carol days too :D 

today i did my laundry :) 
i don't know why i haven't went off to sleep cause I AM VERY TIRED. 
i am so tired i just sit down and stare into space. @_@ 
and i am a bit hungry. and i want new clothes, new shoes, my anime schoolbag/briefcase, high knee socks and massu shop photos !! the new photos are soooo cute, and i feel that massu is everything good in the world. AHAHA. 

on a more spiritual note, God is the one who is everything good in the world. :D 
but God, I am so tired to read my bible now. :c if I fall asleep later, forgive me okays! 
but I will definitely make effort to read! YOSH !

long day tomorrow, i shall sleep soon :)
chumi!

p.s. I really like massu's outfit with the furry hat and canary yellow cardigan. he's cuter than a canary in that outfit! but then again, he's always cuter than a canary :x

I was very tempted to start this post with another list of finallys but decided against it cause well, I just don't want it to be the same. :) But anyways! Finally, my nails are not plain and ugly anymore but bright, hot RED. :D Its so pretty! :x AHAHAHA! But then just now while I was busy doing the laundry, one of my pretty nails got chipped! :( v unhappy about it, but I am still v happy with the color of my nails. :) 

I have also finally purchased a box of Liese's bubble bubble dye, after seeing carol's pretty newly-dyed hair. I couldn't take it and also want to dye my hair. AHAHA! :D But I will only dye my hair after a trim tomorrow. Then I WILL HAVE PRETTY SWEET PINK HAIR. :D 

I am unable to make it for tomorrow's members meeting because of japanese lessons. But after yesterday, God re-taught me a lesson on faithfulness. On friday after meeting vivian, the truth started to sink in that she is going to change shepherd v soon. And I thought of the time since I became her shepherd and I know that I wasn't faithful enough with her and I am not proud of that. I am glad though, that at the end of the day I became her friend. And although I know I didn't push her enough to grow, I am glad that she didn't leave God. Of course, I wished I did better. Felt a lot like the wicked, lazy servant who only hid the talent he was entrusted in in a hole. :( :( :( I told God that I know that perhaps, He won't entrust me with another life anytime soon but I requested God to give me a chance again in the future, after I have grown to be more faithful with the little things in Christian life. And so now, I will be working to be faithful in all that I have. 

As I was saying...When I heard about the situation about our church building I was very disturbed and affected because I know that I still owe God so much for church building fund. And I know this is one of the coming trainings that God is going to use to grow my faithfulness. And so, I have decided to give the remaining of the extra pocket money that my father gave me to the church building fund. That way, I will be giving God what is due His and I will know with clear conscience that I did make a contribution to God's Hope church, that is my spiritual home and birth place that have blessed and gave me so so much. :) Please know that Hope Church did NOT pressure anyone of the members to give financially, but that this is a personal choice that I made out of my repentance of lack of faithfulness! 

Next week onwards I will officially start uni lessons! I am quite excited for it! :D But then... the problem now is...I DON'T KNOW WHERE THE LECTURE NOTES ARE UPLOADED AT! D: 
LOL, feels a bit bimbotic but I really don't know where to find it. :( 

I shall go sleep after I come back with another post in which I just need to ramble about NEWS. AHAHHA :x I am really tired! But today was a v fun day with carol but then again, sundays with carol are always fun! :D

konbanwa! :D I am here to post a small but cute massu translation! :) here's june/july's translation of massu's small eating column in Wink Up! JUNE TABEMASU This month's menu: Saniro dango (three-colored rice cakes) Continuing from last month's Sakura mochi, this month too, we're having Japanese sweet snacks for Tabemasu! Don't you think that somehow, massu suits these dangos? (laughs) Hitotsu me wa ore! (I think it means:) "the first that you see is ME!" Massu aww that's cute isn't it? ----------- JULY TABEMASU This month’s menu: Fruits Punch (the katakana says ponchi but it means punch. well, I suppose this is japan's fruit punch) Following the Japanese sweet snacks would be something that matches the increasing atmospheric temperature! For this month, we have tropical fruits punch for Tabemasu! Of course Japanese sweet snacks are good but this colorful fruits fits massu exactly this season!! pictures on the left (top) Massu saying: Fruit Punch! Punching the fruits with a "GUU" , this one word. As one would expect from Massu! (bottom) This pose of Massu who came to have a big spoon for an eye. This has been Massu who is always thinking of these interesting, fun things to enjoy. ----------- Oh, don't we all know his baka humour. xD But because its Massu, its cute and so, easily forgivable. ♥ I hope you enjoyed it!

I just saw the new myojo (august, and its still june, LOL) scans and I am appalled by massu's parting in his hair. OMG, please let it be just the way his hair is set for that photo shoot !! I like your normal fringe sooo much better, you look so cute with it ♥ 

And I was reading the translations. :D I have this exact same habit as massu, LOL. I always wake up 2-3 hours earlier than the meeting time for outings (unless its school or very early meetings. school is a completely different thing altogether, LOL) and then I will take my morning shower and slack slack slack and then I would panic at the last half hour and get ready, LOL.

And I totally agree with shige's lamentations about supermarkets not having food packed in one-person portions !! That's why I am so lazy to grocery shop and cook as well, because there is always a whole lot of veggies left in the refrigerator which will plasmolyse (lol, bio term). For meat at least you can freeze it but not veggies. D: And I made a new discovery, kei-chan will make another good house-husband. He's good with cleaning and he even ENJOYS cleaning. xD well, I figured shige will be a pretty good house-husband too since he cooks well and he's not bad with cleaning. AHAHA. 

Well, massu is not bad either. He's good with cleanliness and neatness and he does the laundry very well (even using washing nets T_T), and has a heart for helping with household chores. ♥ Its the cooking that he needs to improve in. HAHAH. 

NEWS ♥ 

Okay, enough fangirl ramblings. (and this is not even supposed to be a fangirl post.) :P I came back to do another post because I figured that I should update a bit about my life. :) 

Just one week back to Singapore and I have already had 2 expensive meals. :P One was Hokkaido Ramen with amanda ♥ and the other was the scrumptious sugoku meccha oishii meal at Tampopo with janice ♥ Good food and good company is the best. :D

Yesterday was spent with darling rei ♥ and ing ♥ (finally see you, ing! :D I'm so happy you are back!) and we had a good meal at tea party. Okay, rei and I anyway, since ing only had the meccha oishii scones. Oh and during work on wednesday, pauline taught me how to use the expresso machine so I know how to make coffee and froth the milk, its really fun and I am not bragging, but I am pretty good at it. For a first time anyway, lol. I made the cafe latte which rei ordered, hehheh. :D Went for CG after time with darlings and I saw PW and she went crazy and I went crazy, LOL. I haven't seen her in a century and so we were so happy to see each other. :) Carol, you did a really good job in worship, I really felt God's presence during worship and that was the first in a long time that I really felt God during CG worship. :) 

Met up with hazel one-on-one for the first time on wednesday before work and I was worried that I would be too quiet and it would become awkward but no, she was really open to me and that helped me to warm up and open up to her really fast. :) I am looking forward to meetings and sharing sessions with hazel again. :D 

And I think I've got... Separation Anxiety Disorder (SAD), LOL. And, no, obviously its not an official medical term or condition but well, the thing is that I feel lonely a lot when I am not with any of my friends/people who I love. D: And if I were to text and not get a reply, even if I know they are busy, I would worry and get anxious. T_T OMG, I sound like a very annoying and possessive girlfriend. D: 

I know this is not good, and I don't understand why I feel like this either. Holy Spirit, please fall on my life and fill my heart with Your presence and everlasting joy (which I know was just awakened in my heart a few days ago, which makes me even more unhappy with myself. why this melancholy and I am puzzled as to what happened to my joy. :( ) 

But I am convicted even more that I really cannot go back to life without God, even with this weird melancholy/loneliness. :) I need God in my life and I am not ashamed of that. :) 

Today, I met up with my father for lunch and as always, one-on-one meetings with my father ends up rather silent and awkward. Demo, I really don't know why I just am unable to warm up to him easily, its very difficult for me, though I know that I really should. Its not that I am uncomfortable with his presence but then I just don't know how to be honest with my actions and so I am always quiet. I worry that he thinks I don't want to meet him at all though and sometimes I seem that I don't want to, but its really because I don't like to face that awkwardness. And always when he leaves, I will feel very guilty for not trying harder to talk to to him. :( 

Sigh, I am sorry father. :( 
And I am sorry, heavenly Father. :( 

And I have been slacking at home since my my father sent me home. Since I stood at the window and watch him make his way to the bus stop and take the bus. This is one thing I always do, I always watch him leave, guilt in my heart and wishing I am able to warm up to him more. He never allows me to take the bus when I am with him, he always takes the taxi with me. Only when he's alone, he takes the bus. I don't understand cause I take the bus everyday, LOL, but what he does, its yasashii and I appreciate it. :) 

I shall shower, do QT and come back online :) 
Tomorrow is time with God and cool CG :D

I am very tired and I need to sleep very soon, tomorrow is another early start to the day! Last day of Conference D: I am kinda sad, though I have to admit I will not miss the waking up early, LOL! So because I need to catch my sleep, I will only type down today's highlight today, and that is ANEW: Prophetic Night (= Concert/Extended Prayer Meet) 

I thoroughly enjoyed the whole of ANEW, from the introduction performances (OMG THE LITTLE BOY WAS SOO CUTE) to praise, worship and of course, prayer. :) I was very happy during praise, it had that youth camp last night feeling and we were all just so hungry and happy for God's presence which really rained upon us in the convention hall. :) 

But the highlight of the highlight was worship and prayer in which God not only spoke, but also assured me. Throughout the Conference, I was aware of myself who wasn't faithful enough in terms of being a true disciple-maker. I have not been a good shepherd to my sheep. 

All because of my stupid insecurity. My stupid insecurity that has been capping all that I can do in God, limiting what God can do through me, limiting how God can use me to impact Vivian's life. God didn't speak to me in a harsh way, but today He opened up my eyes to how I have not been loving Vivian as how God should. I have been "loving" her as a friend, protecting my friendship with her too much, protecting my friendship with her more than I am protecting her. All this time, I have been being selfish. My stupid fear of ruining our friendship if I were to tell her what I need to tell her, it has caused me to allow her to step into areas that she should not have taken into as a Christian. I have not been leading her close to God but allowing her to find her way to God on her own with half-hearted guidances here and there because I was too afraid to displease her or affect the friendship. I cried so badly. Not because of myself, but because this life that was entrusted to me, I wasn't careful with it. I allowed my own stupid feelings of inadequacy to allow this precious daughter of Christ (and precious sister of mine) to draw away from God as she make uninformed choices on her own. 

I hated myself for not taking care of this life properly, it felt that spiritual blood was on my head. But God didn't intent it that way, He is only opening my eyes and He told me that I am still responsible for this life. I still can make amends and bring this precious life back to Him. But I need to do so in courage. I need to speak the truth to her, to protect her from the world, as how Jesus would do, and bring her back, close to God. And during prayer, He told me through this leader (we had a prayer session where you go to DLs and such for prayers and I don't even know the name of that leader, LOL) that I am loved so dearly and I am the apple of His eye. And that I am able to lead, to disciple, to shepherd and nurture people to, themselves, become disciples. But I need to claim it by faith and take courageous action! 

And so I will. I still don't know how to start but I will. Love her by telling the truth, protect my sheep and her relationship with You, not my relationship with her.

I reallyyyyy need to stop being such a stupid person, limiting what I can do for God. Limiting what God can do through me. Definitely, I will stop living the "easy" Christian life. I am going to be a Disciple and a Disciple-maker. One that lasts to the very end of course. :)

OMGGG, THE TIME. SLEEP NOW. NIGHTS
EDIT;

Basically, other than ANEW, one truth that struck myself and many others as well in Day 2 of Conference is how its sooooo important as a Christian to lead a life that is credible and holy in the eyes of the Lord and the world. I believe that why Christianity does not expand even more, its because of the deeds of Christians that are ever so... terrible. 

We must be 100% Pure in Christ. 
Even 98% purity is not going to be good enough. Your 2% sins will destroy everything, just like how its so important that your newater is 100% and not 98% pure, but with 2% of sewage. But as human beings, we are sinners and will continue to be and its not that God is stressing you to lead a sinless life. But more of holy life, that is possible with sincere repentance and dependence on Him through everyday. :)
